alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 19 at 1:22PM PDT until August 19 at 6:15PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST/545 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of west central Arizona, including the following county, La Paz. Portions of southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MST /545 PM PDT/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Highway 72 in central La Paz County has reports of flooding across the roadway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 PM MST /118 PM PDT/, radar continues to show light rainfall across the area with rain rates of 0.10 to 0.20 inches per hour at times. Flooding is already occurring. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area through the rest of the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parker, Quartzsite, Bouse and Poston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
